page.title: 11 Friar's Court Farming
page.content: All the stock is bred by artificial insemination, there are no bulls on the farm. The male calves are kept for beef and all the fat stock are sold for meat under two years; there is a milking herd of 70 Fresians. All the dairy cows are kept in a covered yard in winter and fed on silage, the beef cattle are fattened on barley in yards. The farm crops are supplemented by about 100 tons of commercial feedstuffs. The exact acreage of cereals each year depends on the size of fields under cultivation. This year there were 180 acres of wheat and 130 acres of barley. The grass, about 170 acres, is sown every two or three years as a break crop. After grazing by the milk cows most grass is cut for silage or hay. 40 acres of oil seed rape is also grown as an additional break crop.
